dcterms:creator: X. Shang
R. Heide
P. Menard
E. Kaufmann
M. Valko
dcterms:description: Gaussian distributions are used for best arm identification, where the expected reward is modeled as a normal distribution with known variance.
dcterms:title: Gaussian distributions for best arm identification

dcterms:creator: J. Y. Audibert
S. Bubeck
R. Munos
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on the best arm identification problem in multi-armed bandits, providing a framework for selecting the arm with the highest expected reward.
dcterms:title: Best arm identification in multi-armed bandits

dcterms:creator: L. J. Hong
W. Fan
J. Luo
dcterms:description: A review of ranking and selection literature, providing insights into methodologies for selecting the best option among multiple alternatives.
dcterms:title: Ranking and selection literature

dcterms:creator: C. Healey
S. Andradottir
S. H. Kim
dcterms:description: This dataset involves selection procedures for simulations with multiple constraints, focusing on independent and correlated sampling.
dcterms:title: Constrained ranking and selection

dcterms:creator: S. Andradottir
S. H. Kim
dcterms:description: This dataset presents fully sequential procedures for comparing constrained systems via simulation, providing methodologies for effective decision making.
dcterms:title: Fully sequential procedures for comparing constrained systems

dcterms:creator: Y. Russac
C. Katsimerou
D. Bohle
O. Capp√©
A. Garivier
W. M. Koolen
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on A/B testing with control in the presence of subpopulations, addressing the complexities of testing in diverse groups.
dcterms:title: A/B testing with control in the presence of subpopulations

dcterms:creator: A. Garivier
E. Kaufmann
dcterms:description: This dataset provides insights into optimal best arm identification with fixed confidence, focusing on the efficiency of selection processes.
dcterms:title: Fixed confidence best arm identification

dcterms:creator: S. E. Chick
dcterms:description: This dataset discusses subjective probability and Bayesian methodology, providing a framework for decision making under uncertainty.
dcterms:title: Subjective probability and Bayesian methodology

dcterms:creator: S. H. Kim
B. L. Nelson
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on selecting the best system, providing methodologies for effective decision making in operations research.
dcterms:title: Selecting the best system
